clean_content:
Definition / general

* Part of spectrum of reactive mucocutaneous disorders with maculopapular vesiculobulbous eruptions that includes erythema multiforme (EM - minor and major), Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS, if more mucosal involvement and epidermal necrosis) and toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN)* Due to cancer, collagen vascular disorder, drugs, infection* Oral erythema multiforme: variant with only oral lesions and no skin involvement

Case reports

* 21 and 23 year old women with drug induced lip and oral ulcerations ([J Oral Maxillofac Pathol 2012;16:145](22434953))* 40 year old man with oral variant precipitated by alcohol ([Indian J Otolaryngol Head Neck Surg 2011;63:9](22754823))

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityerythemamultiformeclinical1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3303512/figure/F1/)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityerythemamultiformeclinical2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3303512/figure/F2/)

21 year old woman:   
 irregular lip uclerations and buccal mucosal

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityerythemamultiformeclinical3.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3303512/figure/F4/)

23 year old woman:   
 palatal ulcerations

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityerythemamultiformeclinical4.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3146678/figure/Fig1/)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityerythemamultiformeclinical5.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3146678/figure/Fig2/)

40 year old man:   
hemorrhagic bullae and target lesions

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Necrotic keratinocytes, spongiosis, basal layer liquefaction, dermal edema, perivascular or interface lymphocytes
